definition[0]: used to ask someone to repeat what they have just said
example[0]: ‘The meeting’s on Wednesday.’ ‘I beg your pardon?’ ‘I said the meeting’s on Wednesday.’
definition[1]: used to say sorry when you have made a mistake, or said something wrong or embarrassing
example[1]: Oh, I beg your pardon. I thought you said 15 pence, not 50.
definition[2]: used to show that you strongly disagree with something that someone has said, or think it is unacceptable
example[2]: ‘Chicago’s an awful place.’ ‘I beg your pardon, that’s where I’m from!’
